title: AT&T Lays Out Price, Show Lineup for HBO Max
summary: AT&T to charge $14.99 for new service featuring 'South Park' and shows from Greg Berlanti, Mindy Kaling. AT&T Inc. played it safe with its new streaming service HBO Max by selling it for $14.99 a month, the same price it currently offers for HBO, and making it free for current HBO customers.

title: Mattel Resolves Accounting Probe
summary: Toy maker searches for new CFO and will restate some earnings in resolution that removes roadblock to refinance debt; stock jumps. Mattel Inc.'s chief financial officer is leaving, and the company is restating some past earnings after completing an investigation into accounting issues raised in a whistleblower letter.

title: The Marathon Star Who Wins With His Arms
summary: As prize money for wheelchair racers rises, Daniel Romanchuk uses his 6-foot-10 wingspan to dominate competitors. The newest American marathon star has won five major races in just over a year. He's already qualified for Tokyo 2020. And he's only 21 years old.

title: California Fights to Contain Fires Before Winds Pick Back Up
summary: Firefighters battle blazes in the north and south during small window of favorable conditions. SANTA ROSA, Calif.-California firefighters raced against the clock to contain blazes and set up fire breaks ahead of a wind shift expected to fan flames as utility companies cut power to more than half a million customers in preparation for the dangerous conditions.

title: FDA Committee Recommends Withdrawing Makena
summary: Study published last week found Makena wasn't effective as a treatment. A U.S. Food and Drug Administration advisory committee recommended Tuesday that the standard treatment to prevent women from having another preterm birth, Makena, be withdrawn from the market in a 9-to-7 vote following a public hearing.

title: Parties Spar Over White House Aide in Combative Hearing
summary: Democrats accuse Republicans of using appearance by Col. Vindman to try to unmask whistleblower. WASHINGTON-Testimony of a White House national security official turned combative Tuesday as Democrats accused Republicans of trying to unmask the whistleblower who sparked the impeachment inquiry of President Trump, while the GOP lawmakers argued theirs was a legitimate line of questioning.

title: Uber, Lyft Unveil Ballot Initiative to Counter California Gig-Economy Law
summary: With DoorDash, companies promised to spend combined $90 million to challenge AB5 rules. Uber Technologies Inc., Lyft Inc. and other ride-hailing and on-demand companies in California said Tuesday they submitted a ballot initiative that would alter a statewide law intending to reclassify contract workers as full-time employees.

title: J&J Says Suspect Baby Powder Is Asbestos-Free
summary: Health regulators found asbestos in a bottle of its baby powder. Johnson & Johnson said Tuesday its testing didn't find asbestos in bottles of Johnson's Baby Powder, including the bottle that U.S. regulators recently said contained the carcinogen.

title: Senators Confront Boeing CEO on Response to 737 MAX Crashes
summary: The plane maker's chief, Dennis Muilenburg, faced questions about a faulty flight-control system that led to two crashes. WASHINGTON-Lawmakers sharply criticized Boeing Co. 's chief executive in a contentious hearing Tuesday, trying to pin down what he knew about internal concerns that employees appear to have raised about the flight-control system that led to two fatal crashes of the 737 MAX.

title: House Passes Resolution Marking Armenian Genocide
summary: Measure, opposed by Turkey, draws large bipartisan majority. The House voted overwhelmingly to commemorate the 1915 Armenian genocide in a rebuke to North Atlantic Treaty Organization ally Turkey, which has strongly opposed any such move for decades.

title: Hostilities Rise Inside G/O Media Over Autoplay Video Ads and Politics
summary: Management and staff battle over ad strategies and editorial edicts. The publisher of the former Gawker Media websites is showing video advertisements that play automatically on its sites' article pages and with the sound on, igniting resistance from staffers who oppose the tactic.

title: Venezuelan Opposition Files Lawsuit Attacking Citgo-Backed Bonds
summary: U.S.-backed opposition leaders said $1.7 billion in bonds secured by a controlling stake in Citgo are unenforceable. Venezuela's opposition government escalated its efforts to protect Citgo Petroleum Corp. from seizure, seeking a U.S. court order erasing bondholders' collateral rights over the state-owned refiner and invalidating $1.7 billion in debt.

title: Boris Johnson's Brexit Election
summary: Corbyn could win if the Tories fail to offer a vision of Greater Britain.. Boris Johnson on Tuesday finally cajoled Britain's reluctant Parliament to call a December general election to try to settle Brexit. It's a brave and desperate gamble-and one that will work only if he runs a campaign persuading voters to embrace a Brexit vision bigger than the divorce deal he needs a new Parliament to pass.

title: Denver's Education Stakes
summary: Unions want to kill Michael Bennet's successful reforms.. The school-reform movement is a victim of its own success as charters compete successfully with traditional public schools, prompting a political backlash from unions across the U.S. From New York to Boston to Houston to Los Angeles, school reformers have suffered political setbacks, and next week voters will decide the fate of reform in Denver, one of the cities where it has been most successful in lifting students.

title: Arizona Could Decide the 2020 Election
summary: The Democrats' most comfortable path to victory runs through Mesa, not Milwaukee.. Assume, as I do, that President Trump survives a Senate trial and is renominated as the Republican candidate for president. With one year to go until the election, here are a few things we can say about the emerging contest.

title: Revolutionary California
summary: Can 40 million suffer third-world electric reliability without a political upheaval?. California may well be entering a pre-revolutionary situation as the Marxists would call it. Unlike the rolling blackouts of 19 years ago, today's outages cannot be stopped with a simple act of regulatory courage, which then consisted simply of guaranteeing that suppliers would get paid for power they supplied under long-term contracts.

title: Arrests at U.S. Southern Border Hit Highest Level in More Than a Decade
summary: More than half of those arrested were people traveling as families and unaccompanied children. Border Patrol agents arrested more than 851,000 people crossing the U.S.'s southwest border during the fiscal year ended in September, a 12-year high and more than double the previous year's total, U.S. Customs and Border Protection said on Tuesday.

title: Why Virginia Is Turning Blue
summary: The governor survived a blackface scandal, and next week his party may take over the legislature.. Alexandria, Va.

title: I Can Defeat Trump and the Clinton Doctrine
summary: The U.S. will stop trying to overthrow governments and police the world.. Hillary Clinton emerged recently to claim, with no basis in fact, that I am being "groomed" by the Russian government to undermine America. As a major in the National Guard who served in Iraq-one of the many disastrous regime-change wars Mrs. Clinton championed over her career-I swore an oath to only one authority: the U.S. Constitution.

title: Not Everything Is Facebook's Fault
summary: Congress wants to hold Zuckerberg accountable for sex trafficking, white supremacy and more.. Mark Zuckerberg isn't the source of society's woes, though you'd never know that based on his appearance before the House Financial Services Committee last week. He was summoned to discuss Facebook 's digital currency project, but his inquisitors had no shortage of other topics in mind.

title: The Washington Post and al-Baghdadi
summary: The alleged academic career of the murderous terrorist.. Last weekend the Washington Post changed an appalling headline after readers expressed their disappointment. But the paper's bizarre obituary for terrorist Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi may still need a rewrite.

title: Refugees Live the American Dream
summary: Trump lets states opt out of resettlement. They shouldn't do it.. President Trump recently signed an executive order allowing governors and mayors to stop refugee resettlement in their states and localities. It'd be a mistake to take the president up on his offer.

title: Conyers Jazzed Up the Capitol
summary: The art form had no bigger booster in Congress than the long-serving Michigan representative.. Jazz has lost a friend and champion. Within the arts community, longtime Rep. John Conyers, who died Sunday at 90, was regarded as one of the most persistent and influential advocates of this uniquely American music. I knew him for more than 30 years, working together on jazz initiatives at the Smithsonian Institution. We bonded over the genre, which he championed as a proud product of African-American and American culture. Sometimes he would invite me to his office to talk about the music, and he spoke frequently at the Smithsonian, including (to my everlasting gratitude) at my 2017 retirement party.

title: 'American Demagogue' Review: Preaching Revolution
summary: How much influence did the Great Awakening, driven by evangelists like George Whiteﬁeld, have on the cause of American independence?. Academic historians have a testy relationship with popular history writers. Many a history professor has produced a weighty, path-breaking tome, only to find that when some nonfiction writer produces a beach read on the same topic, it outsells the academic title by thousands of copies. But some of the most popular history authors do thoroughly consult academic histories, integrating them into gripping narratives preferred by the reading public.

title: Social Justice Comes to Math Class
summary: Students debate Seattle's plan to 'rehumanize' K-12 mathematics with talk of 'privilege' and 'oppression.'. Editor's note: This Future View is about Seattle's plan to teach math with an ethnic-studies and social-justice twist. Next week we'll ask about the advanced age of major politicians. Elizabeth Warren is 70. Donald Trump is 73. Joe Biden is 76. Bernie Sanders is 78. Do those facts tell us anything meaningful about U.S. politics? Students should click here to submit opinions of fewer than 250 words before Nov. 5. The best responses will be published that night.

title: Facebook Sues Israel's NSO Group Over Alleged WhatsApp Attack
summary: Social-media giant has sued NSO Group for its alleged involvement in a campaign to hack phones and messages. Facebook Inc. has filed a lawsuit against Israel's NSO Group, alleging the cybersecurity company's spyware infected the phones of some users after it was delivered through the WhatsApp messaging platform.

title: Sondland's Testimony About Ukraine Investigations Under Scrutiny
summary: Three witnesses in House impeachment inquiry have contradicted ambassador's recollections of July White House meetings. WASHINGTON-It's become a case of he said, they said.

title: Higher Prices and Volumes Boost Mondelez
summary: Snack maker saw global revenue increase to $6.36 billion in third quarter. Mondelez International Inc. is making gains thanks to higher prices and growing appetite for snacks.

title: BMW Taps China Executive as CIO
summary: Alexander Buresch to succeed Klaus Straub, who had been in the CIO post since 2014. BMW AG named a China-focused executive as its chief information officer after the departure of its previous IT chief, who had been in the role since 2014.

title: Grubhub Deals Gut Check for Food-Delivery Companies
summary: Embrace of discounts to lure customers leads investors to question industry's profitability. Grubhub Inc. is raising tough questions-about the future of its own industry.

title: Menendez Seeks Probe of Pompeo Trips to Kansas
summary: Secretary of state's visits have prompted speculation about a possible 2020 Senate run in his home state. WASHINGTON-A senior Senate Democrat filed a complaint on Tuesday about Secretary of State Mike Pompeo's repeated trips to Kansas, saying they warranted an investigation into whether he was engaging in political activity while traveling in an official capacity on taxpayer funds.

title: New York Lawmakers Debate a Tough Topic: Kids Playing Football
summary: A proposed bill would ban kids under 13 from playing organized tackle football. New York legislators heard from coaches, league officials, scientists and former football players during a Tuesday hearing to consider a bill banning children under age 13 from playing organized tackle football.

title: Sony to Shut Down PlayStation Vue Streaming TV Service
summary: Japanese conglomerate plans to end service in January amid heavy competition, rising content costs. Sony Corp. said it plans to shutter its PlayStation Vue streaming television service early next year due to intensifying competition, as technology and media companies inundate consumers with video options.

title: Labor Secretary Scalia to Participate in Financial-Advice Rulemaking
summary: Department attorneys say ethics rules don't require recusal; Scalia had led challenge to Obama-era fiduciary rule. WASHINGTON-Labor Secretary Eugene Scalia can participate in the department's rewrite of a closely watched investment-advice rule, career government ethics attorneys said on Tuesday.

title: BP Swings to Loss on Weaker Oil Prices, Repair Costs
summary: One-time items aside, the London-based oil giant's third-quarter results beat analysts' expectations. BP PLC said it swung to a loss in third-quarter earnings resulting from a divestment-related charge and lower earnings in its exploration and production business.

title: Biden Allies Launch Super PAC to Support 2020 Bid
summary: The former vice president expressed an openness to an outside political fundraising group last week. WASHINGTON-Allies of Joe Biden have launched an independent fundraising group to support his 2020 presidential bid as he faces an onslaught of advertising from President Trump and Republicans.

title: Kellogg Looks to Snacks for Growth
summary: Food maker's U.S. cereal sales continue to decline. Kellogg Co. is leaning on snacks like Pringles and Cheez-Its for growth, as its U.S. cereal sales continue to decline.

title: Senator Asks Whether Biden Probe Was Linked to China Trade Talks
summary: Wyden sends letters to senior administration officials after trade adviser Navarro declined to address questions. WASHINGTON-A Democratic senator asked the Trump administration to clarify whether U.S. officials sought to inject an investigation of former Vice President Joe Biden into trade negotiations with Beijing.

title: Digital Realty to Buy European Data-Center Operator InterXion
summary: Companies value the deal at $8.4 billion, with debt. Digital Realty Trust Inc. has struck a $7.15 billion deal to buy another data-center operator in Europe.

title: U.K. Parliament Authorizes December General Election
summary: Divisive issue of Brexit expected to dominate fierce campaign. LONDON-British lawmakers voted overwhelmingly to hold a December election, a roll of the dice by parties across the political spectrum to try to either cancel or deliver Brexit after years of wrangling in Parliament.

title: Europe Is Hiring-But Its Workforce Isn't Ready
summary: Businesses ready to pay skilled workers can't find enough candidates, a 'top issue' across the EU. Barbara Colombo sells complex machinery made at her family's factory to businesses in 126 countries but is still having trouble convincing unemployed young Italians to get skills so they can join the workforce.

title: SEC Probes AIG Unit on Retirement Products
summary: Regulators investigating sales and disclosure practices at insurer's Valic unit. The Securities and Exchange Commission is investigating sales and disclosure practices at Valic, a unit of giant insurer American International Group Inc., including the company's dealings with retirement-plan participants at school districts and universities, according to people briefed on the matter.

title: Natural-Gas Prices Jump as Producers Promise Restraint
summary: Prices for the heating fuel are on the rise with forecasts of a cold front. Investors are rewarding energy companies who are promising to produce less energy.

title: Beyond Brexit: U.K. Political Risks Get Even More Complex
summary: A general election carries its own set of dangers for markets. For international investors, understanding Brexit was hard enough. The coming U.K. general election on Dec. 12 makes their lives even more complicated.

title: New York City Council Vote Could Pluck Foie Gras From Menus
summary: Legislation pits farmers against animal-rights activists. A committee of the New York City Council unanimously approved a bill banning the sale of foie gras in the city, a measure that pits farmers against animal-rights activists and ultimately affects a small number of the city's high-end restaurants and food purveyors.

title: Pfizer Raises 2019 Guidance
summary: Third-quarter results lifted by higher sales in biopharmaceutical business. Pfizer Inc . reported strong third-quarter earnings as its focus on bringing new prescription medicines to market showed signs of paying off.

title: Stocks Edge Lower as Investors Parse Earnings Reports
summary: Drug giants Pfizer and Merck climb after boosting their forecasts. U.S. stocks slipped Tuesday, as investors sifted through a heavy batch of earnings reports and awaited key economic data later this week.

title: Grubhub Shares Fall After Downbeat Outlook
summary: Shares of food-delivery company posted biggest one-day decline. Grubhub Inc. shares posted their biggest one-day decline ever Tuesday, underlining intensifying concerns among investors over the future of the food-delivery industry.

title: 'Leonardo da Vinci' Review: Genius in Its Many Stages
summary: The multifaceted exhibition at the Louvre commemorating the 500th anniversary of Leonardo's death shows not just his finished works, but the process and evolution behind their creation..

title: The Producer Who Followed His Gut
summary: Robert Evans-who died Saturday and produced 'Chinatown,' 'The Godfather' and more-was a film titan with distinctive taste and a preference for art over profits..

title: Look to Israel for Signs About New York Landlords
summary: At least two investors are shorting the bonds of a prominent New York landlord. It is too soon to know how badly New York City's new rent control laws may batter apartment landlords. But a battle heating up in Israel between a Brooklyn-born developer and a short seller may provide an early clue.

title: Lebanese Prime Minister Hariri to Resign Amid Nationwide Protests
summary: Move comes after weeks of widespread demonstrations under a backdrop of a currency crisis and struggling economy. BEIRUT-Lebanese Prime Minister Saad Hariri announced his resignation after nearly two weeks of nationwide protests, triggered in part by a currency crisis and struggling economy.

title: FDA Recommends Measures to Curb Drug Shortages
summary: Shortages often occur among drugs that are older and relatively inexpensive, FDA says. WASHINGTON-Drug shortages are increasing, the Food and Drug Administration said in a report to Congress Tuesday, leading to instances where hospitals are rationing lifesaving medicines.

title: GM Factory Strikes Hit Bottom Line by Nearly $3 Billion
summary: Auto maker cuts full-year profit outlook; third-quarter results top analysts' forecasts. General Motors Co. lowered its full-year profit outlook, saying the 40-day strike at its U.S. factories wiped out nearly all its free cash flow for the year and will cost the Detroit auto maker close to $3 billion in lost earnings.

title: Federal Judge Temporarily Blocks Alabama Abortion Curbs
summary: Ruling halts strictest curbs on procedure passed in U.S. this year from taking effect. A federal judge temporarily blocked the most restrictive abortion law passed in the U.S. this year from taking effect in Alabama, the latest in a string of rulings shutting down enforcement of abortion prohibitions approved by many conservative states.

title: 'Hittin' the Ramp: The Early Years (1936-1943)' by Nat King Cole Review: A Master of the Keys
summary: Before he built a formidable career as a singer, Cole was a great jazz pianist; a new set reminds us of his virtuosity..

title: NCAA Clears Way for Athletes to Earn Endorsement Money
summary: The decision comes a month after California passed a law requiring schools in the state to allow college athletes to profit from their name, image and likeness. The NCAA cleared the way for college athletes to begin profiting from their name, image and likeness on Tuesday, a landmark decision that could dramatically alter the economics of college sports.

title: Futures Exchange Reins In Runaway Trading Algorithms
summary: CME takes emergency measures to combat surging data volumes in Eurodollar futures. The Chicago Mercantile Exchange is cracking down on runaway algorithms in one of the world's biggest futures markets.

title: Juul to Cut About 500 Jobs
summary: New CEO says cuts and reorganization part of a 'necessary reset' as e-cigarette company shifts focus. Juul Labs Inc. plans to cut roughly 500 jobs by the end of the year, according to people familiar with the matter, reversing the embattled e-cigarette maker's rapid staff growth as the company braces for a proposed ban on flavors that make up more than 80% of its U.S. sales.

title: The Ultimate Thanksgiving Guide, Revisited
summary: Since 1931, 'Joy of Cooking' has guided cooks across America through holiday feasts and everyday feeding. The first new edition in over a decade reflects 21st century values-and the traditions we're determined to preserve. WHILE MEGAN SCOTT picked sprigs of thyme and sage in the backyard of her Portland, Ore., home, her husband, John Becker, turned their oven up to 425 degrees and maneuvered a 12-pound turkey into a roasting pan. The turkey had spent 24 hours in the refrigerator, letting a dusting of salt absorb into its flesh, but there was no buttering, brining or basting to be done.

title: Uber Money Helicopters Into Rewards War
summary: The new offering promises 5% cash back on helicopter rides. Forget Ben Bernanke, there is a new way to get your hands on some helicopter money: 5% cash back on a chopper flight from Manhattan to John F. Kennedy International Airport.

title: Andrew Cuomo Tilts at Illusory Windmills
summary: The governor has been pulling out all the stops for New York City to get half its electricity from offshore wind power by 2035.. Gov. Andrew Cuomo's bullying games via placing restrictions on natural gas for New Yorkers ("Cuomo's Carbon Contradiction," Review & Outlook, Oct. 21) is the opening act of a bigger and more brazen attack on New York's power supply-and New Yorkers' wallets.

title: 'Asian-American' Is Too Broad to Be Useful
summary: If the goal is truly diversity, then it is instructive to review the term "Asian.". Your editorial "Legalizing Discrimination" (Oct. 21) reminds me of the Institute for Effective Governance's claim: "Efforts to achieve racial and ethnic diversity are commonplace on American college campuses." Made up of current and former trustees of major universities, the institute fails to recognize the tremendous diversity that exists within the social construct we call "race." Take Judge Allison Burroughs's recent ruling against Students for Fair Admissions which alleges discrimination against Asian-Americans. She claims: "ensuring diversity at Harvard relies, in part, on race-conscious admissions." If the goal is truly diversity, then it is instructive to review the term "Asian."

title: Accountability Would Help in PG&E Fiasco
summary: Accountability starts with the utility itself and the funding of its vegetation-management program. The last link in the accountability chain is the public-services commission.. Once again the PG&E leadership is suspending service to paying customers to prevent possible fire damage ("PG&E Warns of Blackouts This Week," Business & Finance, Oct. 22). What we see happening at PG&E is a complete breakdown of accountability.

title: Juul Labs Names New CFO Amid Wider Management Reshuffle
summary: Guy Cartwright joined the company in July as transformation and operations officer. Embattled e-cigarette maker Juul Labs Inc. said Tuesday it has appointed a new chief financial officer amid a wider management shuffle.

title: Concentrate on the Team, Not the Numbers in Baseball
summary: Baseball is no longer a team sport.. Joseph Epstein describes some of the problems with baseball ("Diamonds Are Forever, but Baseball Has Changed Too Much," op-ed, Oct. 22). He dances around the main problem, which is the game is no longer a team sport. Far too much emphasis is placed on the accomplishments of individual players rather than the team. The metrics must be shifted to highlight the team, which is the only thing that really matters to the fans. How many fans of last-place teams talk about how great their players are? Baseball needs to shift the analytics to team-related numbers, then the strikeout will be registered as "bad" as it should be, and the home run will be "good" only if it contributes to a team victory.

title: Turkish Leader's Political Star Rebounds With Syria Invasion
summary: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan's sagging domestic fortunes are lifted by Turkey's fight against a Kurdish militia in Syria, even as it is condemned abroad. ISTANBUL-Turkey's longtime leader, Recep Tayyip Erdogan, had suffered political blows in recent months from a recession and unease over millions of Syrian refugees, reflected in key election losses and rare defiance from ruling party bigwigs over his authoritarian and nepotistic ways.

title: Kurdish Fighters Withdraw From Syrian Border Area, Russia Says
summary: Turkish leader says talks continue with Moscow on patrolling proposed 'safe zone'. BEIRUT-The last remaining Kurdish fighters exited Syria's northern border area as a cease-fire period ended on Tuesday, Moscow said, clearing the way for Russia and Turkey to secure the area.

title: Toward a Root-and-Branch Reform of Public Education
summary: We need to decide who is in charge of our children's education.. Regarding the Oct. 23 letters on school reform: Real radical change in schools requires a radical change in educational thinking, not just radical change in who is in charge of the school. Any successful school needs dedicated and qualified teachers and an administration and staff that can provide the needed support for both the teachers and students because teaching requires a relationship of respect between teacher and student.

title: Evelyn Wood's Speed-Read Course Helped Me a Lot
summary: I paid for the Evelyn Wood course, and found it was one of the best investments I ever made.. Regarding Eric Felten's Oct. 11 Bookshelf review of Marcia Biederman's "Scan Artist": While in law school in the early 1970s I paid for the Evelyn Wood course, and found it was one of the best investments I ever made. Thousands of court opinions, documents and transcripts were digested far easier and faster than I could otherwise have managed, thanks to her Reading Dynamics class. After a career that included handling numerous civil fraud cases, I can affirm there was no fraud whatsoever in the marketing of Mrs. Wood's excellent speed-reading course.

title: BP's Earnings Fall Flat
summary: The oil giant overdelivered compared with adjusted expectations in the latest quarter, but the market wasn't impressed. The market was unimpressed as BP cleared a low earnings bar.

title: Dollar Edges Lower as Investors Await Fed, Data
summary: Signs that the central bank is done reducing rates could jolt the U.S. currency higher. Investors are gearing up for a Federal Reserve meeting and key economic data later this week that could prove pivotal for the becalmed U.S. dollar.

title: Cloud Giants Again Making It Rain
summary: Combined capital expenditures at Google, Amazon and Microsoft recover from a slowdown. Big Tech didn't keep its wallet closed for long.

title: Trump Attorneys Assert Immunity From Broad Sweep of Law
summary: Legal filings and lawyers' statements show attempt to put president beyond legal reach while in office. WASHINGTON-Over his nearly three years in office, lawyers representing President Trump have made numerous legal arguments that, taken as a whole, would give the president sweeping immunity-even if he were to commit murder.

title: 'Peak Car' Is Holding Back the Global Economy
summary: Protectionism, emissions controls and market saturation drag down a linchpin of world economy. Instead, the company showcased a mobile service that gives you a health checkup, with the slogan: "The star of the Toyota booth isn't a car-the stars are people."

title: Airbus Pulls Far Ahead of Boeing in New Jet Orders, Deliveries
summary: Deal with India's IndiGo Airlines is for the Airbus A320neo single-aisle jetliner, the chief rival to the Boeing MAX. As Boeing Co. struggles to get its 737 MAX back in the air, rival Airbus SE is racing ahead in the jet-making duopoly's annual contest for orders and deliveries.

title: Are the 'Old Vines' Wine Labels Tout Really All That Old?
summary: So many wine bottles are marketed with the term "old vines." But what does that really mean? Our wine columnist investigates. SOMETIMES OLD is good. Sometimes old is bad. In a vineyard, old vines can become frail and diseased and fail to produce fruit. Then again, they can produce wines of complexity and depth. According to Massimiliano Calabretta of Calabretta winery in Etna, Sicily, "The grapes of old vines are deeper and higher quality. More intense and persistent both in smell and mouth."

title: KKR's Earnings Fall as Revenue, Investment Income Decline
summary: Total investment income drops more than 70%; portion of earnings that could be returned to shareholders also falls. KKR & Co . 's profit sank in the third quarter and the portion of earnings that could be returned to shareholders slumped as the firm sold off fewer investments and reported lower transaction fees in its capital-markets business.

summary: Vintners in Scandinavia are growing bold with their marketing, winning awards and prompting predictable sniffs from the French. SLINDE, Norway-Perched on a steep slope overlooking the country's largest fiord, tidy rows of vines spread on the frosted ground underneath towering pine trees.

summary: Shares of the food-delivery company crumble as it says it will have to invest to adapt in the face of a changing and more competitive industry. title: Fed Adds $104.5 Billion to Financial Markets, Buys More Treasury Bills

title: Aramco to Launch IPO Process Nov. 3, List Shares in December
summary: Saudi oil giant hopes its third quarter financial results will reassure investors. title: U.N. Atomic Agency Picks Leader Who Seeks to Strictly Monitor Iran
summary: Argentine diplomat Rafael Grossi was strongly supported by U.S.. The United Nations' atomic agency's board picked a new leader Tuesday with strong U.S. backing who has pledged to shake up the body and strictly monitor Iran's nuclear activities.

title: Twyla Tharp: As a Young Dancer, Not Smiley Enough to Be a Rockette
summary: The choreographer grew up in Indiana and California, with parents who were partial to drive-ins, Technicolor musicals and farm values. Twyla Tharp, 78, is a Tony- and Emmy-winning dancer who has choreographed more than 150 works, many of which combine classical, jazz and pop music. Her new book is "Keep It Moving: Lessons for the Rest of Your Life" (Simon & Schuster). She spoke with Marc Myers.

title: The Big Bet Spurring an NFL Trading Frenzy
summary: There have been more deals this year than ever before as more teams rest their hopes that one player can help enough to justify increasingly steep prices. Two weeks ago, the Los Angeles Rams pulled off a blockbuster trade when they acquired superstar cornerback Jalen Ramsey from the Jaguars. The curious part about this move wasn't the steep price the Rams paid-a pair of first round picks-or the timing, smack in the middle of this NFL season.

title: Hudson Yards: 'Little Dubai' or Down-to-Earth Neighborhood?
summary: Resume Subscription. When Hudson Yards resident Jes Gordon took me on a tour of her neighborhood and offered to show me her favorite watering hole, Bar Stanley, I imagined a street-level dive with Bud on tap.

title: Hong Kong Bars Pro-Democracy Icon Joshua Wong From Election
summary: City increasingly has blocked candidates it deems unacceptable from running for office. HONG KONG-Authorities barred prominent democracy activist Joshua Wong from running in local elections scheduled for next month, citing his political views, a move that risks inflaming an opposition protest movement that has seen momentum in the streets wane in recent weeks.

title: Bank of Canada Likely to Stand Pat This Week
summary: Economists surveyed say economy is showing enough resilience to hold off on rate cuts for now. OTTAWA-Canada's economy is showing enough resilience for the Bank of Canada to leave its key interest rate unchanged at a policy announcement on Wednesday, economists say, making Canada an outlier among advanced economies.

title: Why Some Republicans May Be Choosing to Leave Congress
summary: GOP term limits on committee leadership could be a factor for retiring lawmakers. This item first appeared in the Capital Journal newsletter. Read today's full newsletter here or sign up here for daily updates in your inbox.

title: TPG Hires Chelsea Clinton's Husband
summary: Marc Mezvinsky is managing director and business-unit partner in private-equity firm's new TPG Tech Adjacencies fund. Marc Mezvinsky, the husband of Chelsea Clinton, has joined private-equity firm TPG, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Generational Divide Among Evangelicals Shakes Seminary
summary: Southwestern Baptist Theological Seminary tries to heal rifts after scandal and to unite students and donors with widely divergent views. FORT WORTH, Texas-After the Rev. Adam W. Greenway stepped to the lectern during his inauguration as the ninth president of the Southwestern Baptist Theological Seminary, he acknowledged the tumult that had engulfed the school in recent years.

title: Mastercard's Earnings Rise 11%
summary: A 15% increase in revenue helped to boost profit. Mastercard Inc.'s profit rose 11% from the comparable quarter a year earlier, driven by an increase in revenue.

title: Why Cindy Sherman Thinks Selfies Are a Cry for Help
summary: For four decades, artist Cindy Sherman has been reinventing the portrait, using her shape-shifting self as her subject and exploring our obsession with identity. For a woman whose career has been built on self-portraits, Cindy Sherman is barely recognizable. In the flesh, the MacArthur Fellowship-winning photographer looks too friendly, too nice to be the same face that stares out from harshly manipulated self-portraits (whatever you do, don't call them selfies) depicting scary clowns, aging flappers, royalty from old master paintings, society ladies and even creepy social media influencers.

title: Already Freezing? Try a Desert Retreat
summary: Three desert retreats, with their wide-open vistas and off-the-grid settings, provide a more serene, scenic alternative to the beach. When it comes to holidays in the sun and sand, beaches get all the attention-and most of the tourists, too. Deserts, with their wide-open vistas and off-the-grid settings, provide a more serene, scenic alternative. Here, three new retreats that encourage us to unplug and unwind.

summary: Recalls largely relate to certain 2015 to 2017 Ford Transit vehicles. Ford Motor Co. said it is recalling about 320,000 vehicles in North America for various safety reasons.

title: Official to Testify Trump's Ukraine Phone Call Raised Concerns
summary: National Security Council aide Alexander Vindman also to tell impeachment investigators Sondland made Ukraine meeting with Trump contingent on probes. WASHINGTON-A top official with the National Security Council plans to tell House impeachment investigators that he was concerned by President Trump's July phone call with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky, saying that the president's request to have the Ukrainians investigate Joe Biden and his son may have been interpreted as a "partisan play."

title: WeWork Debacle Teaches Investors a Lesson About Value
summary: The shock of WeWork's failed IPO has helped awaken investors from the dream that easy finance will last forever. Perhaps all you need to do to play the stock market is pay close attention to WeWork.

title: China's Blockchain Revolution Won't Set Investors Free
summary: While Beijing is obsessed with controlling flows of information and capital, bitcoin is designed precisely to avoid government control and surveillance. Chinese President Xi Jinping on Thursday elevated blockchain, the encrypted digital ledger technology, to "core" technology status in China, virtually guaranteeing significant investment. Prices for blockchain technology companies and the popular blockchain-based cryptocurrency bitcoin leapt, with the latter up by around 30%. Is this the next big Chinese technology investment opportunity?

title: Ex-Banker Bids to Cash In on South African Takeover of Central Bank
summary: Shareholders led by a former Goldman Sachs analyst are hoping to cash in on the plan to nationalize the publicly traded South African Reserve Bank. PRETORIA, South Africa-Activist shareholders eyeing a multibillion-dollar payout have zeroed in on an unusual target: South Africa's central bank.

title: Towns to Self-Storage Facilities: Please Go Someplace Else
summary: Resume Subscription. Local governments across the country are feeling overstuffed with self-storage facilities.

title: Vacasa Becomes Latest Property Unicorn
summary: Silver Lake leads $319 million funding round, as investors pile into the short-term-rental sector. Vacation-rental management company Vacasa LLC is joining the ranks of property firms with unicorn status, as investors pour more money into the booming short-term housing sector.

title: Big Pig Gap in China Could Lift WH Group
summary: The world's largest pork producer could benefit from China's decimated hog population as the country gobbles up meat from abroad.. A deadly epidemic has decimated China's hog population. The world's largest pork-producing company, WH Group , could benefit as the country gobbles up meat from abroad.

title: Central Banks Could Play a Role in Tackling Climate Change, Paper Says
summary: Research suggests central banks can contribute based on the kinds of securities they buy in support of their stimulus efforts. The world's top central banks can do more to adapt their monetary policies to help mitigate climate-change risks without giving up on their other goals such as curbing inflation and boosting the economy, according to a new research paper.

title: Fed's Powell Faces Tightrope Act Framing Potential Pause on Rate Cuts
summary: Central bank officials debate how and whether to signal a timeout after a likely third rate reduction this week. WASHINGTON-Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell will walk a tightrope this week over whether and how to signal a potential timeout in rate cuts following an expected reduction on Wednesday.

title: Government Remedy for Bond Ratings Has Failed
summary: Postcrisis plan enabled unsolicited ratings, meant to limit bond issuers' ability to exert influence over ratings firms. Few, if any, such ratings have been published..

title: Teens Explain Their YouTube Obsession (Because Adults Don't Get It)
summary: High-schoolers tell the WSJ why they love the video social network, but also acknowledge its dark side: 'Don't use it as a babysitter'. It's a question many adults have pondered: Why are kids so fascinated with YouTube? How can they watch a seemingly endless stream of slime-making how-tos, makeup tutorials and hydraulic-press videos? In search of the answers, I ventured to rural Texas to hear it straight from the mouths of teenagers themselves.

title: The Real Economic Threat to South Korea
summary: South Korea's private sector has levered up significantly, and the country is heading into a difficult economic period of diminishing growth and inflation. The governments in Seoul and Tokyo aren't the best of friends at the moment. That's a shame, since South Korea has a particularly important economic lesson to learn from Japan.

title: Google to Face Court on Claims It Misled Australians on Personal Data
summary: The country's competition regulator alleges Google collected and used sensitive personal location information without consumers making an informed choice. SYDNEY- Alphabet Inc.'s Google is being taken to court by an Australian regulator that alleges the internet giant misled customers about how it collected and used personal location data.

title: Kids Living Near Fast-Food Outlets Have Higher Obesity Rates
summary: Analysis comes as studies show high percentages of overweight schoolchildren. The closer a child in New York City lives to a fast-food restaurant, the more likely the child is to be overweight or obese, according to a new analysis by researchers at New York University School of Medicine.
